item.text:
This Act amends the Fair Minimum Wage Act of 2007 to make the applicable minimum wage rate for each American Samoa industry and classification the one in effect on May 1, 2015.

Scheduled increases to such minimum wage are repealed.

The government of American Samoa shall determine the amount and time of such future increases.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. RADEWAGEN:H.R. 2574.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3--The Congress shall havepower . . . to regulate commerce with foreign Nations, andamong the several States, and with the Indian Tribes.[Page H3577]

item.fullName: Rep. Radewagen, Aumua Amata Coleman [R-AS-At Large]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

bill.title: To amend the Fair Minimum Wage Act of 2007 to stop a scheduled increase in the minimum wage applicable to American Samoa and to provide that any future increases in such minimum wage shall be determined by the government of American Samoa.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

item.latestTitle: An act to amend the Fair Minimum Wage Act of 2007 to reduce a scheduled increase in the minimum wage applicable to American Samoa.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
